text:
*Hey, I'm going to ask this in the forum but I figured one more attempt here would be worth it:* 

Is there a way to hide the "don't use style tags warning" in the drag and drop email editor? I think this use is valid (because HubSpot ultimately strips out the <style> tag and inlines the code:
```<style type="text/css" 
  data-hse-inline-css="true">
</style>```
If you put in a <style>, the warning will appear. There isn't a way to turn it off permanently. You can always ignore it and continue on with the email. :slightly_smiling_face:
<@U01CT3U61JS> I think what's interesting here or possibly an opportunity is that that <style> tag with `data-hse-inline-css` never makes it into the email. So the warning is irrelevant/incorrect
but it's *definitely* scary to the other members of my team
maybe a "show warning" based on role is a possible (but less ideal) fix

At this time, that is not possible to customize who sees the warning.  Any good idea should always be added to our ideas board! <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/Ideas/ct-p/ideas>
I encourage you to post there! With enough upvotes, it may be considered for development. :slightly_smiling_face:

I have a local module I've created for an email template that has a repeatable field group. The group contains a Choice field. When I use `{{ item.field_name }}` it spits out the value. Is there a way to spit out the _label_ as well?
I donâ€™t think this is possible unless you can add do this `{{ item.field_name.label }}` ?
